prompt: TEXT: Fire investigators said lighting is the suspected cause of a fire that consumed a home on the Lake Champlain shoreline in South Hero. The home belongs to Green Mountain Power President and CEO Mary Powell and her husband Mark Brooks. Blaze was reported around 7pm when strong thunderstorms moved through the area. No human fatalities or injuries were reported, but two dogs and two cats died in the fire. QUERY: Can you expand the previous outline into a passage of about 372 words?
completion: Fire investigators said lightning is the suspected cause of a fire that broke out on Tuesday and consumed a Vermont lakefront home belonging to the CEO of the state's largest electric utility. The blaze at the South Hero home of Green Mountain Power President and CEO Mary Powell and her husband Mark Brooks was reported around 7pm whenstrong thunderstorms moved through the area. Fire officials said the family was not home when the fire erupted and the cause of the fire is still under investigation, according to WCAX. No human fatalities or injuries were reported, however four family pets - two dogs and two cats - died in the fire. In a text message to the Burlington Free Press, Powell said the aftermath of the fire was 'rough.' Mike Bishop of the South Hero Fire Department said some rescue workers were treated for minor injuries and thatthe flames were contained in about 30 minutes. Footage from the scene showed thick black clouds of smoke billowing from the two-story home located off Sweeney Farm Road, which was recently assessed at $1,724,700, the Burlington Free Press reported. During the fire, neighbors reportedly gathered at a safe distance as they offered support to the family as well as firefighters. As fire crews from several agencies responded to the blaze, they had some trouble reaching the property because of the rural nature of the roads leading to the home. Unfortunately for Powell and her husband, they previously lost a house to fire, according to the Burlington Free Press. Powell has served as head of Green Mountain Power since 2008, and was previously in the role as the corporation's chief operating officer for seven years, according to the company's website. Thanks to her efforts in launching an 'ambitious energy vision to provide low carbon' and 'reliable power to Vermonters,' the company has subsequently built the state's largest wind farm. The company said it has also made Rutland the 'solar generation capital of New England,' installing smart-grid technology across the entire utility infrastructure. In 2004, Powell was recognized as one of the 'top 50 fast leaders' in the US by Fast Company and in 2014 was recognized as Woman of the Year by Powergen, according to the company.

prompt: TEXT: Peyton Manning may be keeping quiet about his future football plans, but not his dad. In an interview shortly after Peyton's Super Bowl win on Sunday, his father Archie toldNFL Network; 'I think Peyton's done in Denver. He may be done everywhere. I don't know that. But that's my guess.' He then added that he believes his son has made up his mind about whether or not to retire, but has yet to share his decision with the family. Peyton, who will turn 40 in March, would only say that he planned to 'reflect' on the future after his big win. If Peyton does decide to keep playing there is a chance he could return to the Broncos next season as he still has a year left on his contract. Reports have also emerged that the newly relocated St. Louis Rams are interested in signing the quarterback. Scroll down for video This has been a particularly difficult season for Manning, despite the fact that he capped it off with a Super Bowl victory. His play was uneven at the start of the season and in Week 10 he was benched by head coach Gary Kubiak after throwing four interceptions against Kansas City. It was announced the following day that he was suffering from plantar fasciitis and would not play the following week, leading many to speculate that he was soon to be replaced by backup quarterback Brock Osweiler. He was back at starting quarterback by the end of the season however, and despite having the worst season of his 18-year career was able to get his second Super Bowl thanks in large part to the Broncos strong defense. Peyton was also asked to take a $4million pay cut by the Broncos at the beginning of the season, a loss he managed to recoup by collecting the $2million bonuses promised to him if the team won the AFC Championship Game or the Super Bowl. He is also the focus of an NFL investigation after a report emerged alleging he had used human growth hormones to recover from a 2012 neck injury, a banned substance in the league. Peyton said after Sunday's game he did not want to make a public announcement and take away from the team, though he did plug Budweiser in two of his post-game interviews leading some to speculate it was a sign he planned to retire. NFL guidelines do not allow active players to promote any sort of alcoholic drink or alcoholic beverage. QUERY: In around 126 words, write a TLDR (Too Long Didn't Read) summary for the above text.
completion: Peyton Manning has refused to announce if he plans on retiring next year or playing another season. He has one more year left on his contract with the Denver Broncos and the Los Angeles Rams are reportedly interested in possibly signing him. His father Archie said Sunday night;'I think Peyton's done in Denver. He may be done everywhere. I don't know that. But that's my guess'. Archie added that he believes his son has made up his mind about whether or not to retire, but has yet to share his decision with the family. Peyton, who will turn 40 in March, would only say that he planned to 'reflect' on the future after his big win. For full coverage of the Super Bowl 50 visit www.dailymail.co.uk/superbowl.

prompt: TEXT: On 21 August 2013, the WeLiveSecurity blog, published by the ESET security company, reported that since version 4.1.1.15, Orbit Downloader includes a botnet-like module which performs DDoS attacks without the user's knowledge or permission. QUERY: The entity type of 'Orbit Downloader' is 'street'. 'True' or 'False'?

TEXT: The European stonechat was formally described by the Swedish naturalist Carl Linnaeus in 1766 in the twelfth edition of his Systema Naturae under the binomial name Motacilla rubicola.[2] This species is now placed in the genus Saxicola that was introduced by the German naturalist Johann Matthus Bechstein in 1802.[3][4] The English name derives from its call, sounding like two stones knocked together. The scientific name Saxicola means "rock-dweller", from Latin saxum meaning "a rock" and incola meaning "dwelling in". The specific epithet combines the Latin rubus meaning "brambles" with incola.[5] The subspecies name hibernans refers to Ireland (Latin, Hibernia). QUERY: Given the subject 'European Stonechat' and object 'Saxicola', what's the relation between them? 'family name', 'instance of', 'parent taxon', 'after a work by' or 'located in the administrative territorial entity'?

Peyton, who will turn 40 in March, would only say that he planned to 'reflect' on the future after his big win. If Peyton does decide to keep playing there is a chance he could return to the Broncos next season as he still has a year left on his contract. Reports have also emerged that the newly relocated St. Louis Rams are interested in signing the quarterback. Scroll down for video This has been a particularly difficult season for Manning, despite the fact that he capped it off with a Super Bowl victory. His play was uneven at the start of the season and in Week 10 he was benched by head coach Gary Kubiak after throwing four interceptions against Kansas City. It was announced the following day that he was suffering from plantar fasciitis and would not play the following week, leading many to speculate that he was soon to be replaced by backup quarterback Brock Osweiler. He was back at starting quarterback by the end of the season however, and despite having the worst season of his 18-year career was able to get his second Super Bowl thanks in large part to the Broncos strong defense. Peyton was also asked to take a $4million pay cut by the Broncos at the beginning of the season, a loss he managed to recoup by collecting the $2million bonuses promised to him if the team won the AFC Championship Game or the Super Bowl. He is also the focus of an NFL investigation after a report emerged alleging he had used human growth hormones to recover from a 2012 neck injury, a banned substance in the league. Peyton said after Sunday's game he did not want to make a public announcement and take away from the team, though he did plug Budweiser in two of his post-game interviews leading some to speculate it was a sign he planned to retire. NFL guidelines do not allow active players to promote any sort of alcoholic drink or alcoholic beverage. QUERY: In around 126 words, write a TLDR (Too Long Didn't Read) summary for the above text.
completion: Peyton Manning has refused to announce if he plans on retiring next year or playing another season. He has one more year left on his contract with the Denver Broncos and the Los Angeles Rams are reportedly interested in possibly signing him. His father Archie said Sunday night;'I think Peyton's done in Denver. He may be done everywhere. I don't know that. But that's my guess'. Archie added that he believes his son has made up his mind about whether or not to retire, but has yet to share his decision with the family. Peyton, who will turn 40 in March, would only say that he planned to 'reflect' on the future after his big win. For full coverage of the Super Bowl 50 visit www.dailymail.co.uk/superbowl.

prompt: TEXT: On 21 August 2013, the WeLiveSecurity blog, published by the ESET security company, reported that since version 4.1.1.15, Orbit Downloader includes a botnet-like module which performs DDoS attacks without the user's knowledge or permission. TEXT: The European stonechat was formally described by the Swedish naturalist Carl Linnaeus in 1766 in the twelfth edition of his Systema Naturae under the binomial name Motacilla rubicola.[2] This species is now placed in the genus Saxicola that was introduced by the German naturalist Johann Matthus Bechstein in 1802.[3][4] The English name derives from its call, sounding like two stones knocked together. The scientific name Saxicola means "rock-dweller", from Latin saxum meaning "a rock" and incola meaning "dwelling in". The specific epithet combines the Latin rubus meaning "brambles" with incola.[5] The subspecies name hibernans refers to Ireland (Latin, Hibernia). QUERY: Given the subject 'European Stonechat' and object 'Saxicola', what's the relation between them? 'family name', 'instance of', 'parent taxon', 'after a work by' or 'located in the administrative territorial entity'?

prompt: TEXT: Fire investigators said lighting is the suspected cause of a fire that consumed a home on the Lake Champlain shoreline in South Hero. The home belongs to Green Mountain Power President and CEO Mary Powell and her husband Mark Brooks. Blaze was reported around 7pm when strong thunderstorms moved through the area. No human fatalities or injuries were reported, but two dogs and two cats died in the fire. QUERY: Can you expand the previous outline into a passage of about 372 words?
completion: Fire investigators said lightning is the suspected cause of a fire that broke out on Tuesday and consumed a Vermont lakefront home belonging to the CEO of the state's largest electric utility. The blaze at the South Hero home of Green Mountain Power President and CEO Mary Powell and her husband Mark Brooks was reported around 7pm whenstrong thunderstorms moved through the area. Fire officials said the family was not home when the fire erupted and the cause of the fire is still under investigation, according to WCAX. No human fatalities or injuries were reported, however four family pets - two dogs and two cats - died in the fire. In a text message to the Burlington Free Press, Powell said the aftermath of the fire was 'rough.' Mike Bishop of the South Hero Fire Department said some rescue workers were treated for minor injuries and thatthe flames were contained in about 30 minutes. Footage from the scene showed thick black clouds of smoke billowing from the two-story home located off Sweeney Farm Road, which was recently assessed at $1,724,700, the Burlington Free Press reported. During the fire, neighbors reportedly gathered at a safe distance as they offered support to the family as well as firefighters. As fire crews from several agencies responded to the blaze, they had some trouble reaching the property because of the rural nature of the roads leading to the home. Unfortunately for Powell and her husband, they previously lost a house to fire, according to the Burlington Free Press. Powell has served as head of Green Mountain Power since 2008, and was previously in the role as the corporation's chief operating officer for seven years, according to the company's website. Thanks to her efforts in launching an 'ambitious energy vision to provide low carbon' and 'reliable power to Vermonters,' the company has subsequently built the state's largest wind farm. The company said it has also made Rutland the 'solar generation capital of New England,' installing smart-grid technology across the entire utility infrastructure. In 2004, Powell was recognized as one of the 'top 50 fast leaders' in the US by Fast Company and in 2014 was recognized as Woman of the Year by Powergen, according to the company.
